mission_apply_drill_text.base_text: Mount the drill on the gate outside the vault area.
mission_apply_drill_text.loc_text: Mount the drill on the gate outside the vault area.

mission_blow_wall.base_text: Blow a hole in the wall (Management.)
mission_blow_wall.loc_text: Blow a hole in the wall (Management.)

mission_blow_wall_text.base_text: Apply C4 to the wall next to the server room and blow a hole into the neighboring building.
mission_blow_wall_text.loc_text: Apply C4 to the wall next to the server room and blow a hole into the neighboring building.

mission_bridge_escort.base_text: Escort the prisoner to the top of the right tower. When he's at the top, strap him down in the chair and send him skyward with the balloon.
mission_bridge_escort.loc_text: Escort the prisoner to the top of the right tower. When he's at the top, strap him down in the chair and send him skyward with the balloon.

mission_bridge_get_hostage.base_text: Locate the prisoner! He's in one of the trucks. Saw the doors open.
mission_bridge_get_hostage.loc_text: Locate the prisoner! He's in one of the trucks. Saw the doors open.

mission_bridge_heli_clear.base_text: Hold the tower, wait for the airplane and make sure George snatches up the chair!
mission_bridge_heli_clear.loc_text: Hold the tower, wait for the airplane and make sure George snatches up the chair!

mission_bridge_identify.base_text: Send up the Balloon so George can fly in and pick up the Ejection Seat.
mission_bridge_identify.loc_text: Send up the Balloon so George can fly in and pick up the Ejection Seat.

mission_bridge_jump.base_text: Make it to the Bridge Pillar and take the stairs to the waiting scuba gear.
mission_bridge_jump.loc_text: Make it to the Bridge Pillar and take the stairs to the waiting scuba gear.

mission_bridge_locate_convoy.base_text: Make your way further along the bridge and locate the prison convoy.
mission_bridge_locate_convoy.loc_text: Make your way further along the bridge and locate the prison convoy.

mission_diamond_codes.base_text: Get to the vault doors and enter the codes to gain access to the vault.
mission_diamond_codes.loc_text: Get to the vault doors and enter the codes to gain access to the vault.

mission_diamond_escape.base_text: Make your way to the helicopter. It can't stay in the same place for too long!
mission_diamond_escape.loc_text: Make your way to the helicopter. It can't stay in the same place for too long!

mission_diamond_escort1.base_text: We need to pressure Mr. Garnet into giving us the access codes to the vault. Bain is trying to locate the CFO using security footage, but try to find him sooner than that.
mission_diamond_escort1.loc_text: We need to pressure Mr. Garnet into giving us the access codes to the vault. Bain is trying to locate the CFO using security footage, but try to find him sooner than that.

mission_diamond_escort1_hl.base_text: Change of plan, get the CFO.
mission_diamond_escort1_hl.loc_text: Change of plan, get the CFO.

mission_diamond_escort2.base_text: Find Mr. Garnet's son Ralph and take him to our chopper on the roof.
mission_diamond_escort2.loc_text: Find Mr. Garnet's son Ralph and take him to our chopper on the roof.

mission_diamond_loot.base_text: Enter the vault and steal the diamonds.
mission_diamond_loot.loc_text: Enter the vault and steal the diamonds.

mission_diamond_sneak.base_text: Sneak around and gain access to the consoles controlling the vault doors. If the alarm goes off, Bain will have to hack the remaining consoles.
mission_diamond_sneak.loc_text: Sneak around and gain access to the consoles controlling the vault doors. If the alarm goes off, Bain will have to hack the remaining consoles.

mission_diamond_sneak_hl.base_text: Sneak and access the alarm boxes.
mission_diamond_sneak_hl.loc_text: Sneak and access the alarm boxes.

mission_diamond_timelock.base_text: Wait for the time lock to expire.
mission_diamond_timelock.loc_text: Wait for the time lock to expire.

mission_diamond_wait.base_text: Wait while Bain is negotiating for the codes.
mission_diamond_wait.loc_text: Wait while Bain is negotiating for the codes.

mission_empty_vault_text.base_text: Empty the Vault! Get the Cash!
mission_empty_vault_text.loc_text: Empty the Vault! Get the Cash!

mission_enterelevator_pickup.base_text: Take the elevator to get to the exit on the roof.
mission_enterelevator_pickup.loc_text: Take the elevator to get to the exit on the roof.

mission_escape_text.base_text: Get down to the underground garage and make your escape.
mission_escape_text.loc_text: Get down to the underground garage and make your escape.

mission_get_drill_text.base_text: Get the drill and the thermite.
mission_get_drill_text.loc_text: Get the drill and the thermite.

mission_get_into_bank_text.base_text: Get inside and don't draw attention to yourselves!
mission_get_into_bank_text.loc_text: Get inside and don't draw attention to yourselves!

mission_get_into_vault_text.base_text: Keep an eye on the drill - it jams.
mission_get_into_vault_text.loc_text: Keep an eye on the drill - it jams.

mission_get_key_text.base_text: Find the bank manager - Look for a yellow outline once he's identified.
mission_get_key_text.loc_text: Find the bank manager - Look for a yellow outline once he's identified.

mission_hospital_atrapp.base_text: Set up the fake sentry guns so that the civilians will stay down.
mission_hospital_atrapp.loc_text: Set up the fake sentry guns so that the civilians will stay down.

mission_hospital_cameras.base_text: Take out all the cameras in and around the reception area.
mission_hospital_cameras.loc_text: Take out all the cameras in and around the reception area.

mission_hospital_cooler.base_text: Put two validated samples into the cooler.
mission_hospital_cooler.loc_text: Put two validated samples into the cooler.

mission_hospital_cooler_hl.base_text: PUT TWO VALIDATED SAMPLES INTO THE COOLER.
mission_hospital_cooler_hl.loc_text: PUT TWO VALIDATED SAMPLES INTO THE COOLER.

mission_hospital_enterelevator_hl.base_text: TAKE THE ELEVATOR TO THE ROOF.
mission_hospital_enterelevator_hl.loc_text: TAKE THE ELEVATOR TO THE ROOF.

mission_hospital_getToPatient.base_text: Using the saw, open up the security door that holds the contaminated patient.
mission_hospital_getToPatient.loc_text: Using the saw, open up the security door that holds the contaminated patient.

mission_hospital_getToPatient_hl.base_text: PICK THE RIGHT DOOR TO OPEN.
mission_hospital_getToPatient_hl.loc_text: PICK THE RIGHT DOOR TO OPEN.

mission_hospital_hatch.base_text: Open the hatch to get out of the elevator.
mission_hospital_hatch.loc_text: Open the hatch to get out of the elevator.

mission_hospital_hostage.base_text: Keep the civilians from activating the alarm until Bain is finished scanning the database.
mission_hospital_hostage.loc_text: Keep the civilians from activating the alarm until Bain is finished scanning the database.

mission_hospital_rapport.base_text: Look through the files and find the correct patient file.
mission_hospital_rapport.loc_text: Look through the files and find the correct patient file.

mission_hospital_rounds.base_text: Figure out a way to get to the contaminated patient. Prove your Harvard degree paid off.
mission_hospital_rounds.loc_text: Figure out a way to get to the contaminated patient. Prove your Harvard degree paid off.

mission_hospital_rounds_hl.base_text: FIND OUT WHERE THE CONTAMINATED PATIENT IS.
mission_hospital_rounds_hl.loc_text: FIND OUT WHERE THE CONTAMINATED PATIENT IS.

mission_hospital_waitElevator.base_text: Wait for the elevator to arrive while making sure to keep the power running.
mission_hospital_waitElevator.loc_text: Wait for the elevator to arrive while making sure to keep the power running.

mission_sec_doors.base_text: Some consoles are still online. Plant the tablets on and let Bain hack the alarm system.
mission_sec_doors.loc_text: Some consoles are still online. Plant the tablets on and let Bain hack the alarm system.

mission_sec_doors_hl.base_text: Plant tablets on the remaining alarm boxes.
mission_sec_doors_hl.loc_text: Plant tablets on the remaining alarm boxes.

mission_security_footage_text.base_text: Locate the hacked computer and use it to erase the Security Footage!
mission_security_footage_text.loc_text: Locate the hacked computer and use it to erase the Security Footage!

mission_thermite.base_text: Pour out the thermite to melt the floor (above the vault).
mission_thermite.loc_text: Pour out the thermite to melt the floor (above the vault).

mission_thermite_text.base_text: Pour out the thermite in the office above the vault - it will burn a hole through the steel floor. There are two cans of thermite hidden in the copy machine, if both are carried to the vault it will speed up the melting process.
mission_thermite_text.loc_text: Pour out the thermite in the office above the vault - it will burn a hole through the steel floor. There are two cans of thermite hidden in the copy machine, if both are carried to the vault it will speed up the melting process.

mission_thermite_wait_text.base_text: Hold the fort and let the thermite burn through the floor. There are two cans of thermite hidden in the copy machine, if both are carried to the vault it will speed up the melting process.
mission_thermite_wait_text.loc_text: Hold the fort and let the thermite burn through the floor. There are two cans of thermite hidden in the copy machine, if both are carried to the vault it will speed up the melting process.

mission_trough_lobby_text.base_text: Get through the Lobby and make your way to the hallway outside the server room.
mission_trough_lobby_text.loc_text: Get through the Lobby and make your way to the hallway outside the server room.

mission_undercover_check.base_text: Check the Limo and see if you can get the Taxman out of it.
mission_undercover_check.loc_text: Check the Limo and see if you can get the Taxman out of it.

mission_undercover_crane.base_text: While Alex is lifting the limo to the roof, make sure to Keep the FBI at bay.
mission_undercover_crane.loc_text: While Alex is lifting the limo to the roof, make sure to Keep the FBI at bay.

mission_undercover_deal.base_text: Wait until the SERVER is exposed before you hit them! That server is the only way to make our transaction!
mission_undercover_deal.loc_text: Wait until the SERVER is exposed before you hit them! That server is the only way to make our transaction!

mission_undercover_escape2.base_text: Make the escape, a helicopter will pick you up on the neighbouring rooftop.
mission_undercover_escape2.loc_text: Make the escape, a helicopter will pick you up on the neighbouring rooftop.

mission_undercover_escort.base_text: We need to get the Taxman to the transfer room we started out in. Use all necessary force to make him cooperate.
mission_undercover_escort.loc_text: We need to get the Taxman to the transfer room we started out in. Use all necessary force to make him cooperate.

mission_undercover_fasten.base_text: Get the server from the Limo and make your way to the transfer room to plug it in.
mission_undercover_fasten.loc_text: Get the server from the Limo and make your way to the transfer room to plug it in.

mission_undercover_fasten_hl.base_text: GET THE SERVER, PLUG IT IN.
mission_undercover_fasten_hl.loc_text: GET THE SERVER, PLUG IT IN.

mission_undercover_interogation.base_text: Get the codes from Taxman! Screams, threats and a good old beating - anything goes - we are in a hurry!
mission_undercover_interogation.loc_text: Get the codes from Taxman! Screams, threats and a good old beating - anything goes - we are in a hurry!

mission_undercover_power.base_text: See to it that the cops do not cut the power, if they do you have to turn it back on fast to keep the computers running.
mission_undercover_power.loc_text: See to it that the cops do not cut the power, if they do you have to turn it back on fast to keep the computers running.

mission_undercover_roof.base_text: Wait for Taxman to show the server we are after. Scare him into his limo when you see it - we need both the server and the Taxman. Alex will lift him up to us from the open street. Also, keep an eye out for what you can use to better your chances.
mission_undercover_roof.loc_text: Wait for Taxman to show the server we are after. Scare him into his limo when you see it - we need both the server and the Taxman. Alex will lift him up to us from the open street. Also, keep an eye out for what you can use to better your chances.

mission_undercover_saw_limo.base_text: Get Taxman out of the Limo! Saw open the roof and get him out!
mission_undercover_saw_limo.loc_text: Get Taxman out of the Limo! Saw open the roof and get him out!

mission_undercover_shoot_limo.base_text: Shoot at the cables snagging the limo to make it fall!
mission_undercover_shoot_limo.loc_text: Shoot at the cables snagging the limo to make it fall!

mission_undercover_transaction.base_text: Using BAIN's brain, Taxman's insider knowledge and the team's charms - get the IRS data base hacked for a huge tax cut.

sm_10_desc.base_text: Nuclear warheads in the hands of a mobster? Don't ask. Vlad's ready to help you step up. Says he can help you get in touch with the cartels, but the Fed's are combing the streets looking for those missing warheads. Well, let them pull DC apart looking for you. Vlad has another job, and this one is urgent. Get to LA - fast.

Vlad has another job, and this one is urgent. Get to LA - fast.

sm_10_obj.base_text: Complete the Aftershock job on the Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_10_obj.loc_text: Complete the Aftershock job on the Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_12_desc.base_text: Before Vlad hands over any of that powder, he needs a little insurance. The name of the Payday Gang means something new. Having us flex a little muscle on his behalf shows his rivals how far he's come. He's a pain in the ass, I know, but after this he'll be ready to introduce you to his cartel, so it's worth it.

sm_12_obj.loc_text: Complete the Nightclub and Stealing Xmas jobs on the Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_13_desc.base_text: Vlad has hooked us up with a contact in the cartel - Hector Morales. Not quite ready to let us in with their action, not until we prove ourselves. We need to build our notoriety. So time to get a few jobs under our belts. Enough to get your names on the lips of every cop and politician in DC. That should do it.

So time to get a few jobs under our belts. Enough to get your names on the lips of every cop and politician in DC. That should do it.

sm_14_desc.base_text: Hector's ready to work with us. He's looking to move a big shipment of coke to the docks. A very big shipment. Wants us riding in the truck with the product. I'm guessing this amount of blow is going to see Hector move up the ranks in the cartel. Good opportunity for us to move with him.

sm_14_obj.base_text: Complete the Watchdog job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_14_obj.loc_text: Complete the Watchdog job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_15_desc.base_text: The Feds were waiting for us! Someone, inside or outside the crew, but someone close to us, is a rat. We'll figure out who it was, but until then we stay professional. Hector wants us on another job, sticking it to his rivals - the Mendoza cartel. Let's do this. Maybe it will draw the traitor out.

sm_15_obj.base_text: Complete the Firestarter job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_15_obj.loc_text: Complete the Firestarter job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_16_desc.base_text: Hector's got a plan for finishing off the Mendozas, who we reckon are being moved out of the country. Part of that plan is getting info off another gang, the Cobras, but they don't want money - they want meth. Hector won't use his own people for this, so we're going to see the deal goes down. This could be what puts Hector top of the pile, so it's worth our time.

sm_16_obj.base_text: Complete the Rats job in Very hard or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_16_obj.loc_text: Complete the Rats job in Very hard or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_17_desc.base_text: All right, we got a new contact. A politician, calling himself The Elephant. Job is a bit of industrial sabotage. Some hot-shot scientist has figured out cold fusion. Sort of technology that will make the oil companies as dead as disco. And the "Powers That Be" have a lot of money in those companies, so The Elephant and his friends want to make sure this technology gets buried. Fine by me.

sm_18_desc.base_text: Getting that fusion engine off the scene will make The Elephant happy. And a happy Elephant is an Elephant that pays. He's so happy he has something else for us. The Elephant's next play is having us take out one of his opponents. So that's what we do.

sm_19_desc.base_text: The Elephant is more of a back-room power broker. Works through pawns he gets into position, and that is what he wants us to do now. He's got a man - Bob McKendrick - in the running to be DC's mayor. The Elephant wants to make sure his man wins that race.

sm_1_desc.base_text: Before we begin, we gotta wipe your slate clean. That means erasing whatever dirt the Feds already got on you. You're nothing to them right now, so this shouldn't be too hard. Don't worry, I got your back and will talk you through it. Gives me a chance to make sure you're still up for this life.

sm_1_obj.base_text: Complete The Tutorial Heists on stealth and loud or reach reputation level 10.
sm_1_obj.loc_text: Complete The Tutorial Heists on stealth and loud or reach reputation level 10.

sm_20_desc.base_text: I don't like it when people are trying to force our hands but this guy, The Dentist, has the means to get our associate back. If we want to be able to break Hoxton out of prison we have to play along with The Dentist's little plans. Although "little" is truly the wrong word here. The first job he "so kindly" asks us to do might be the biggest job we've done yet. He wants us to prove ourselves with the ultimate bank heist - the Benevolent Bank. It's never been successfully hit. If we pull this off, he says he'll help us get a chance to get Hoxton back. But not for free, I guess we'll hear more from him after the job.

sm_20_obj.base_text: Complete the Big Bank job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_20_obj.loc_text: Complete the Big Bank job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_21_desc.base_text: The Dentist has a job for us, something big, but before that we need to get Hoxton back - he's in maximum security. Getting to him means getting to the District Attorney. Problem is he's being protected by a sack of Russian crap, calling himself The Commissar. Solution? Remove The Commissar. Wet work isn't usually our style but...well, exceptions can be made.

sm_21_obj.base_text: Complete the Hotline Miami job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_21_obj.loc_text: Complete the Hotline Miami job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_22_desc.base_text: Killing The Commissar means The Dentist can get to the DA. And that opens things up for us in the field of maximum security prison transfers. Of course, there's only one guy inside that we care about - our old friend Hoxton. He's a high-value, maximum security prisoner for the Feds. Putting pressure on the DA means we can get Hoxton into position for a break-out. So that's exactly what we're going to do.

sm_22_obj.base_text: Complete the Hoxton Breakout job in Very Hard or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_22_obj.loc_text: Complete the Hoxton Breakout job in Very Hard or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_23_desc.base_text: Hector, that rat, is in the ground. Now, The Dentist is setting us after something special. He's not saying what it is just yet. First things first, though. There's a Diamond at the McKendrick Museum - THE Diamond. It's a valuable rock, and we're after it. The Dentist needs this diamond for something big, really big and we want a piece of it, so lets get get over to the Museum and grab that stone.

sm_23_obj.base_text: Complete The Diamond job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_23_obj.loc_text: Complete The Diamond job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_24_desc.base_text: The Diamond might be worth a King's ransom, but to The Dentist it's just a tool. Well, part of a tool, to be precise. Seems his real prize is stored in one of the world's toughest vaults - the Golden Grin Casino. We may be able to sneak it out of there, but if things get loud we need a plan B. That's why we're bringing in Sokol. He's designed a drill - the biggest ever, with The Diamond on the tip. Pack your bags - we're going to Vegas.

sm_24_obj.base_text: Complete the Golden Grin Casino job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_25_desc.base_text: After the Golden Grin, the Payday Gang is known from DC to LA and all points between. But it looks like you're getting an international reputation too. Got a call from The Butcher. A Croatian arms dealer, looking to make it in America. And who are we to stand in the way of someone following the American dream?

sm_25_obj.loc_text: Complete either The Bomb: Dockyard or The Bomb: Forest jobs  on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_26_desc.base_text: Looks like The Butcher's burgeoning international operations hit something of a snag. The Sosa cartel have been interfering with her shipments. We made a little Balkan friend. Let's keep her that way.
sm_26_desc.loc_text: Looks like The Butcher's burgeoning international operations hit something of a snag. The Sosa cartel have been interfering with her shipments. We made a little Balkan friend. Let's keep her that way.

sm_26_obj.base_text: Complete the Scarface job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_26_obj.loc_text: Complete the Scarface job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_27_desc.base_text: You've come a long way, but don't think for a moment that this is the end. It isn't. You've made the Payday Gang the most wanted gang in the land. Keep it up. Get out there. Rob some banks. Pull off some heists. Do what you do best.

sm_28_desc.base_text: Now that we have our fill of suntans and Tequila Sunrises, it's time to start planning for something juicy again. I got something in mind, but to set it up, we need some help, and the help I have in mind will take some convincing. So we gotta do something to impress them. I've got a couple sweet options for you to pick from...

sm_28_obj.base_text: Complete either The Alesso Heist or the Counterfeit job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_28_obj.loc_text: Complete either The Alesso Heist or the Counterfeit job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_29_desc.base_text: OK, so I've been looking at this one for a while, but needed to be sure we were ready for it. The First World Bank. Old, established, full of secrets and gold, all there for the taking. We're already famous, but this one will get us into the history books.

sm_29_obj.loc_text: Complete the First World Bank job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_2_desc.base_text: Okay, so this might just work out. Preparation is important though. You're a professional. You need the right gear for the job. Okay, there may not be much in the cupboard right now, but as you keep pulling off heists, get notorious, we'll get those racks and cabinets filled with all the right gear.

sm_2_obj.base_text: Go to your inventory and equip a deployable, a perk from any perk deck and also spend five skill points.
sm_2_obj.loc_text: Go to your inventory and equip a deployable, a perk from any perk deck and also spend five skill points.

sm_30_desc.base_text: You gotta wonder how some characters survive this business, but I try to keep an open mind. Anyway, this guy Jimmy wants to work with us, says he has big job lined up. I did some checking and, crazy or not, the grapevine says he's OK, so it might be worth the risk. We better be sure though, because the job involves going up against notorious Russian psycho "Akan". Not to be messed with lightly, from what I've heard. First thing Jimmy wants us to do is intercept a Murkywater transport of... get this- an EMP bomb! Says we're gonna need it for the next phase.

sm_30_obj.base_text: Complete the Murky Station job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_30_obj.loc_text: Complete the Murky Station job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_31_desc.base_text: This whole 'stopping evil psychos' thing is a little out of our comfort zone, but Jimmy is pretty convincing. Maybe we should see this one through. Only thing is... uh... we gotta go to Russia. There's a cache of high-tech data Jimmy wants us to steal, so that Akan doesn't get his hands on it. He's pretty riled up about it. But even if we take Jimmy at his word, and doing this will be kind of a public service, we can probably squeeze a nice bit of profit from it too. And hey, it'll be a change of pace, right? I hear Siberia is nice this time of year...

sm_32_desc.base_text: Yeah... it feels like everyone is asking for help from the Payday Gang now. Vlad wants us to help out his cousin, who somehow got wind of our adventure in the Motherland. He's been good for us so far, so if you're up for it, why not hear what he has to say? Or if you're in the mood for something more... greasy, he also mentioned a warehouse full of bikers that need to be shown the way to some holiday cheer. Up to you, guys.

sm_33_desc.base_text: I usually don't like dealing with anonymous outfits, but a request has been made through the grapevine for an order of Falcogini automobiles, and the payday is substantial, worth looking into. There weren't any specifics, so we can do it on our terms. Might be a ticket to higher gains down the road. There are a lot of cops near the Falcogini dealership though, and we gotta get the cars out clean, so no storm of bullets, OK?

sm_34_desc.base_text: Our old friend The Elephant has brought us a new prospect- a member of a local biker gang. He's a real hard-ass this one, good to have around in a fight. Before he joins up permanently though, he's asked for our help in leaving his gang. Apparently, they don't take kindly to members wanting out. I say we do- it's an investment, and good karma for us. Rust also mentioned a piece of technology in the gang's possession that I could use...
sm_34_desc.loc_text: Our old friend The Elephant has brought us a new prospect- a member of a local biker gang. He's a real hard-ass this one, good to have around in a fight. Before he joins up permanently though, he's asked for our help in leaving his gang. Apparently, they don't take kindly to members wanting out. I say we do- it's an investment, and good karma for us. Rust also mentioned a piece of technology in the gang's possession that I could use...

sm_34_obj.base_text: Complete The Biker Heist on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_35_desc.base_text: Looks like our new heister is settling in. Rust still has contacts around the city and got an interesting tip for us. There's a run-down building being used by a local gang that has a panic room filled with loot. Apparently, the room is virtually break-in proof without damaging the contents, but I've got another idea. I think you're going to have some fun with this one guys.

sm_36_desc.base_text: Hey gang. I got a job for you from The Continental. Turns out they were the ones that took delivery of the Falcoginis, and have been wanting to work with us for a while. Their guy Charon is in deep shit in N.Y.C., needs to be pulled out of a situation. A mutual friend of him and Chains- John Wick, made the introductions. I  got someone else I need to meet there too, that will help us in the future. So, let's get to The Big Apple.

sm_37_desc.base_text: Mayor McKendrick has been a rusty nail in our asses long enough. Time for us to give him some payback. And it's gonna be the kind politicians hate- loss of money. Wick got a tip from Charon about a big fundraiser the Mayor is holding and we're going to crash the place, but quiet-like.

sm_38_desc.base_text: "The taxman cometh", they say. Very profound. What say we make it the other way around? Got us a nice thank-you-tip from the Continental. There's this IRS guy, a real dirtbag, about to sell a hard drive containing very sensitive information worth millions to some corporate slime-balls. If we intercept the deal, we can take that little mint away from them and keep it for ourselves. It'll be like our own version of Robin Hood, stickin' it to The Man to feed all us needy heisters.

There's definitely more to them than what we've seen. They've got a supply line running through D.C. I've been looking at, and it finally looks like something worth our while is coming through.

sm_3_desc.base_text: Okay. The Fed's have nothing on you. You've got the mask. You've got the guns. But have you got what it takes to make the Payday Gang the stuff of legends? Well, it's time to find out. DC's got branch banks and jewellery stores all over. Been a long while since any of them were knocked over. Too long. Let's get rich.

sm_40_desc.base_text: Sometimes fate shows you where your biggest problems are. Keeps you from getting over-confident. Looks like Murkywater got tired of us taking from them and are after revenge. A Murky agent just hacked into Crimenet- says he can shut us down permanently, and I believe him. But he also says he wants to work with us, AGAINST Murkywater. Damn way to say hello, huh? Who knows what this guy really wants, but until we know more about him, we should play along. Make the best of the situation and get some profit out of it. But don't let your guard down for a minute.

sm_41_desc.base_text: Well, how about that. The mountain job turned out pretty nice, under the circumstances. Hope you guys are up for a plane ride. Locke has another job he wants "help" with, onboard a Murkywater cargo plane. He seems hell-bent on pissing all over their operation, which is fine by me. Just keep watching for anything suspicious, 'cause I'm still not convinced he isn't waiting to stick a knife in our back.

sm_43_desc.base_text: Gang, after a little not-so-friendly persuasion, we got us a lead on Kento. A guy by the name of Kazuo supposedly has some info for us, with one little snag; he's rattling bars at D.C. Central. Lucky for you, I've arranged a transfer, so all we gotta do is make sure to grab him when it happens. This one is gonna get really loud, and I don't think we'll be too popular with the D.D.O.T. afterward, 'cause they're gonna be fixing more than potholes- we're taking down a bridge!

If we put a big dent in their finances, it's gonna hurt Locke too, so I've got a little job for you that'll do just that.

sm_46_desc.base_text: Hey gang, I think you guys need a break from D.C. and I've got something real old-school lined up for you. An old friend of mine in the Cabot family, out in La La Land, needs some extra people. It's another job against the Garnet group, which means... more diamonds. I owe this guy a favor from way back, so I need you to get out there and help him. And the payday's good, anyway. Show those Hollywood cosmo-drinkers how the pro's from D.C. handle things. It should be a cakewalk.

sm_47_desc.base_text: Friends, I promise I will see you to the end of this, yeah? Bain has been secretly searching for some kind of Holy Grail Dinges for along time and I am committed to help. He may be gone, but the search will continue. Duke has managed to start uncovering a lot of new leads on it, digging through volumes of ancient lore. Before he got taken, Bain set up a plan to find an artifact buried in the foundation of a bank in Brooklyn. This artifact was put there in the early 1900s and may contain clues we need.

sm_48_desc.base_text: If we believe his message, Bain is truly dead. And the Elephant has been arrested. According to Garrett's email logs, The people behind Bain's capture are called The Kataru; they seem to be some kind of ancient and secret society that uses Murkywater as a front. They are offering to trade Bain's body to Garrett in return for some object connected to Bain's grail-thing, which Duke says is called Baldwin's Lament, or something. So if we're going to finish what Bain started and find this thing, whatever it is, we need that object. And it would be fitting payback to put that chop in a kakspul of trouble, yeah?

sm_49_desc.base_text: Dear friends, I knew I had seen something like the Elephant box before, and remembered a visit I once paid to a secret Murkywater storage and research facility out in the desert. This place is basically the heart of Murky, full of insane projects, and what little I saw made me begin to question how much longer I wanted to work with those dwankies. I had a friend help me hack into the security feed and we've managed to find out that they are in fact holding two almost identical cases. Duke is pretty sure the Kataru were trying to gather them for some reason connected to Baldwin's Lament.

sm_50_desc.base_text: The Elephant, now released from lockup after being falsely charged by that chop Garrett with fake Kataru evidence, is looking for some payback. Looks like he's going to help us find Baldwin's Lament, and Bain too. He's tipped us off about an auction taking place in Salem, Massachusetts where they're offering items from a shipwreck recently discovered in Antarctica. According to the notes and research left by Duke's grandfather, one of the passengers was somehow involved with the Kataru. This passenger was apparently traveling to an unknown location and hoped to divert the course of the ship when it disappeared in 1905. Something he carried with him is apparently important, and you know... an auction with lots of nice, juicy antiques might just boost our coffers a bit, yeah?

sm_51_desc.base_text: OK, here we go. Those Kataru dwankies have had their nasty paws on our Bain for far too long. With information provided by the Elephant, I have managed to find where Bain is being kept. Murkywater has many facilities and this is one of the worst- a run-down prison they bought from the US military in the 70s, located on a small island with a lighthouse. No one pays attention to the place as long as the lighthouse works, because the Murkys are running it through a utilities subsidiary. The prison was originally used to hold Japanese POWs after Pearl Harbor and has been equipped with advanced medical facilities. When I was with Murky, rumor was they did some very nasty experiments there. I'm working on a plan to get you in there and extract Bain. Let's hope we're not too late.

sm_51_obj.loc_text: Complete the Hell's Island job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_52_desc.base_text: Dear friends, the Dentist and those Murky keks have infected Bain with a strange virus while they had him. I managed to pull some information from the Murky mainframe and recognize the codename. The virus is a refined strain of something they got hold of many years ago, when they were contracted by the US government to develop biological toxins using loopholes in existing bio-warfare treaties. I had an old bio-med contact look at it and, while the virus isn't contagious, the situation is blerrie awful. There is no cure. Bain only has, at most, a few days until he is consumed from within. I asked Chains once when Bain's obsession with this whole secret dinges started, and he told me about the Cagliostro manuscript being payment for a hospital job many years ago, involving the blood of a patient in isolation. I remember an incident back at Murky around the same time, with a huge scandal and coverup. One of the... volunteers... Murky was doing medical tests on had gotten out and needed to be contained. It can't be a coincidence. Maybe Bain's search, will ultimately be his end.

sm_53_desc.base_text: Bain knows his time is running out, but he's hell-bent on seeing his crew, all of us, get the reward we deserve before it's over. He was always talking about pulling off the 'greatest heist' or whatever... and I never really did know what he meant, until now. It's like this- at the end of the American civil war, President Lincoln issued pardons to Confederate soldiers, to help unite the country. To make them easier to distribute, many of the documents were left without assignees, and were delivered by his generals. As it happens, some of these pardons still exist, locked away... in the blerrie White House. And listen to this, friends- they are still legal! Imagine getting away with all we've done and retiring... that would indeed be something mighty, yeah? Well, you chops, we're going for it. Now that the building it has been nicely emptied by the dwankies causing all the world-upending ruckus, we can probably get inside. They only seem to have a skeleton crew of Murkys guarding it- no doubt maneuvered in place by the Dentist after the Secret Service and other agencies were relocated. But it's not going to be easy... and it will be an all-or-nothing job. If we fail, it's over. For real, this time.

sm_53_obj.loc_text: Complete The White House job on the Very Hard difficulty or higher.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_5_desc.base_text: Great work. Left those Murkywater goons scratching their asses and wondering where their shit went. Gage is happy, and Murkywater isn't. This means you're starting to get notorious. And, at the end of the day, notoriety is your life-blood. Money can be stolen, see. Gold can come and go. But notoriety - that's what you're really worth. So let's get some more.

sm_5_obj.base_text: Complete the Go Bank and Diamond Store jobs.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_6_desc.base_text: Outstanding. People are starting to hear about the Payday Gang. I told you notoriety matters. You need it to get the real big scores. And the people who supply those scores are watching. They're waiting to see what you can do. I think I have just the jobs to do that.

sm_6_obj.base_text: Complete at least three Transport heists.$NL;Complete the Transport: Train Heist and steal the turret prototype.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.
sm_6_obj.loc_text: Complete at least three Transport heists.$NL;Complete the Transport: Train Heist and steal the turret prototype.$NL;This assignment requires you to play from the lobby to the end of the heist.

sm_7_desc.base_text: You proved you have what it takes to get in, get loud and get the job done. That brings contacts our way. Here's our first - Vlad Kozak. Vlad's crazy. Even for someone spat from the Russian mobscene, this big guy stands apart, Well, he likes your work. We'll see if that's a good thing. But before he lets you into bed with him, you're going to have to do a little grunt work.

sm_8_desc.base_text: Vlad's happy, and, trust me, we want to keep that guy smiling. He's so happy, in fact, he's got a couple of jobs for you that're a little bit personal. Do these for him, he says, and we're gonna be his top guys. Can't hurt to do the big guy a couple of little favors, can it?

sm_9_desc.base_text: Okay, Vlad - well, he likes how you do things. Says he's got a job for you. Something special. Something big. He wants you to boost 'something' from that Murkywater warehouse you hit for Gage, you remember that? Vlad is pitching against the Murkies. Something like that can only end in trouble for everyone. So make sure you hit it hard and fast.

sm_first_safehouse_desc.base_text: Since you'll be out on the streets wreaking havoc, you're gonna need a place to call home- a safe house. I got just the place. It's nothing too fancy but it will have to do for now. Head over there and check it out, then later we can go about making some money.

sm_hoxton_revenge_desc.base_text: Hoxton used his time on the inside well. He wasn't even out of his prison pyjamas before busting in the FBI headquarters and getting everything he could about the rat. No name - the Feds are too canny for that - but the location of the safehouse where the rat is being held. Time to finish this.

sm_moving_up_desc.base_text: OK, I told you before that people are watching you, One guy in particular has an interest in you. I might have something big coming up with this new contact, but the job he has in mind will be difficult and you have to get ready for it. Come back when you've prepped a bit more and I will set you up.
